nova_utils.data.handler.file_handler module

Module for handling File data operations related to annotations and streams. Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 18.8.2023

class nova_utils.data.handler.file_handler.FileHandler(data_type: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: IHandler

Class for handling different types of data files.

load(fp: Path) → Data[source]

Load data from a file.

Parameters:

fp (Path) – The file path.

Returns:

The loaded data.

Return type:

Data

save(data: any, fp: Path, overwrite=True, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Save data to a file.

Parameters:

  • data (any) – The data to be saved.

  • fp (Path) – The file path for saving the data.

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – Whether to overwrite the file if it exists.

  • *args – Variable length argument list. **kwargs: Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Raises:

FileExistsError – If the file already exists and overwrite is not allowed.

nova_utils.data.handler.ihandler module

Interface class for all data handlers Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 18.8.2023

class nova_utils.data.handler.ihandler.IHandler[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for data handling operations.

Subclasses of IHandler must implement the methods ‘load’ and ‘save’ to handle data loading and saving operations, respectively.

abstract load(*args, **kwargs) → Data[source]

Load data using specified arguments and keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Returns:

A Data object representing the loaded data.

Return type:

Data

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented by a subclass.

abstract save(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Save data using specified arguments and keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented by a subclass.

nova_utils.data.handler.mongo_handler module

Module for handling MongoDB data operations related to annotations and streams. Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 18.8.2023

class nova_utils.data.handler.mongo_handler.AnnotationHandler(db_host: str | None = None, db_port: int | None = None, db_user: str | None = None, db_password: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: IHandler, MongoHandler

Class for handling download of annotation data from Mongo db.

load(dataset: str, scheme: str, session: str, annotator: str, role: str) → Annotation[source]

Load annotation data from MongoDB and create an Annotation object.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – Name of the dataset.

  • scheme (str) – Name of the annotation scheme.

  • session (str) – Name of the session.

  • annotator (str) – Name of the annotator.

  • role (str) – Name of the role.

Returns:

An Annotation object loaded from the database.

Return type:

Annotation

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the requested annotation data is not found in the database.

  • TypeError – If the scheme type is unknown.

save(annotation: Annotation, dataset: str | None = None, session: str | None = None, annotator: str | None = None, role: str | None = None, is_finished: bool = False, is_locked: bool = False, overwrite: bool = False)[source]

Save an Annotation object to the MongoDB database.

Parameters:

  • annotation (Annotation) – The Annotation object to be saved.

  • dataset (str, optional) – Name of the dataset. Overwrites the respective attribute from annotation.meta_data if set. Defaults to None.

  • session (str, optional) – Name of the session. Overwrites the respective attribute from annotation.meta_data if set. Defaults to None.

  • annotator (str, optional) – Name of the annotator. Overwrites the respective attribute from annotation.meta_data if set. Defaults to None.

  • role (str, optional) – Name of the role. Overwrites the respective attribute from annotation.meta_data if set. Defaults to None.

  • is_finished (bool, optional) – Indicates if the annotation is finished. Defaults to False.

  • is_locked (bool, optional) – Indicates if the annotation is locked. Defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – If True, overwrite an existing annotation. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The result of the update operation.

Return type:

UpdateResult

Raises:

FileExistError – If annotation exists and is locked or annotation exists and overwrite is set to false

class nova_utils.data.handler.mongo_handler.MongoHandler(db_host: str | None = None, db_port: int | None = None, db_user: str | None = None, db_password: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for handling MongoDB connections.

Args:

db_host (str, optional): IP address of the MongoDB server. db_port (int, optional): Port number of the MongoDB server. db_user (str, optional): Username for authentication. db_password (str, optional): Password for authentication.

data_dir

Path to the data directory for stream files

Type:

Path, optional

property client: MongoClient

Returns the MongoDB client instance.

  • db_port (int) – Port number of the MongoDB server.

  • db_user (str) – Username for authentication.

  • db_password (str) – Password for authentication.

class nova_utils.data.handler.mongo_handler.SessionHandler(db_host: str | None = None, db_port: int | None = None, db_user: str | None = None, db_password: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: MongoHandler

Handler for loading session data from a MongoDB database.

This class provides methods to load session information from a MongoDB collection and returns a Session object.

Parameters:

MongoHandler) ((Inherited args from) –

load(dataset

str, session: str) -> Session: Load session data from the specified dataset and session name.

(Inherited attributes from MongoHandler)
load(dataset: str, session: str) → Session[source]

Load session data from the specified dataset and session name.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – The dataset name as specified in the mongo database

  • session (str) – The session name as specified in the mongo database

Returns:

A Session object containing loaded session information. If the session does not exist, an empty Session object is returned.

Return type:

Session

class nova_utils.data.handler.mongo_handler.StreamHandler(*args, data_dir: Path | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: IHandler, MongoHandler

Class for handling download and upload of stream data from MongoDB.

load(dataset: str, session: str, role: str, name: str) → Stream[source]

Load a Stream object from MongoDB and create a Stream instance.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – Name of the dataset.

  • session (str) – Name of the session.

  • role (str) – Name of the role.

  • name (str) – Name of the stream.

Returns:

A Stream object loaded from the database.

Return type:

Stream

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the requested stream is not found for the given dataset.

  • FileNotFoundError – If the data directory is not set or the file is not found on disc.

save(stream: Stream, dataset: str, session: str, role: str, name: str, data_type: str, file_ext: str = None, dim_labels: [] = None, is_valid: bool = True)[source]

Save a Stream object to the MongoDB database and store associated file.

Parameters:

  • stream (Stream) – The Stream object to be saved.

  • dataset (str) – Name of the dataset.

  • session (str) – Name of the session.

  • role (str) – Name of the role.

  • name (str) – Name of the stream.

  • data_type (str) – Media type of the stream data as specified in NOVA-DB.

  • file_ext (str, optional) – File extension. Defaults to None.

  • dim_labels (list, optional) – Dimension labels. Defaults to None.

  • is_valid (bool, optional) – Indicates if the stream data is valid. Defaults to True.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the data directory is not set.
